full_text:
COURSE NAME: Data Protection Officer

COURSE OVERVIEW: The course is designed to develop a career as a Data Protection Officer. It is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University.

COURSE SCHEDULE: The course starts on January 22, 2025. Classes are held on Sundays and Wednesdays from 17:30 to 21:30. The course consists of 8 meetings, totaling 40 academic hours.

LEARNING FORMAT: The course is hybrid, with classes conducted both on the Bar-Ilan University campus in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, according to the student's choice.

COURSE TOPICS: The course covers a comprehensive range of topics related to data protection and privacy laws.
- Privacy Laws and Regulations in Israel: A detailed overview of privacy protection legislation in Israel, including sectoral rulings and current compliance requirements. This includes guidelines from the Privacy Protection Authority.
- Practical Guidelines: Transitioning from theory to practice with concrete guidelines for building a compliance program to meet Israeli requirements.
- Guest Lecturer on Enforcement in Israel: A guest lecturer with extensive practical experience in enforcing privacy protection laws and regulations.
- Privacy Laws in Europe: In-depth study of European privacy protection laws (GDPR), forming the basis for CIPP/E certification by the IAPP (International Association of Privacy Professionals).
- Overview of Privacy Laws in the USA: A general review of the legal system and privacy protection laws in the USA.
- Final Project: At the end of the course, students are required to create a compliance program for privacy protection laws and regulations in Israel for a company or organization of their choice, which will be presented to the class.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: To schedule an admission interview and registration, contact Esther Asulin at 052-5886002 or esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: Bar-Ilan University is committed to influencing the future today.
